title: Augusta County: Alexander H. H. Stuart to Rev. W. G. Brownlow, 18 August 1856
summary: Stuart responds to an invitation to attend a meeting of Millard Fillmore's political allies in Knoxville, Tennessee, speaking of the dangers of sectionalism and the opposition of the Democratic party with the nascent anti-slavery Republican party in the upcoming presidential election of 1856.
keywords: National Government, Slavery, Unionism, American Civil War
